pages.text: Found mostly in forests and plains, beef can be cooked or cut into patties, providing a rich, fatty meat.$(br)$(br).
Found mostly in more shaded forests, pork can be cooked or cut into bacon, raw pork also being a useful resource for soap.$(br)$(br).
Found most commonly in birch forests, mutton is a hearty meat most useful for a feast, able to be cut into mutton chops. Smaller cuts.$(br)$(br).
Found most commonly in mountain ranges, chevron is not as universally helpful as most meats, yet it's flavor is distinguishing.$(br)$(br).
Found most commonly in plains or low forests, chicken is a universally useful meat, it's cuts provide protein to many meals.$(br)$(br).
Common mostly in deserts, rabbit meat is a delicacy, yet most of it's value is found in it's hide.$(br)$(br).
A newer discovery, this mutation- perhaps decendant, of the pig proves incredibly fruitful in meat, especially with a knife.$(br)$(br).
Documentation of just some of the fauna one can find useful.
